reviews.review_msg: Dana is a great communicator and has a passion for her work and for her students' wellbeing that really comes through in her lectures and any one-on-one discussions. A bit too easy of a marker, though.
Horrible, made no sense, maybe its just archaeology that makes no sense, but she did nothing to help the matter, field of complete and utter bull
Such a nice prof. Cares alot about students. Encourages participation.
The worst teacher I have ever had the mis-pleasure to be mis-educated by.
Very nice lady, tries very hard to help students and is very understanding. Really cares about archaeology and is very knowledgable. Recommend class.

Lectures are a little bit dry, but he often shows videos and relates the course content to his own experiences working in the field which I found pretty interesting. His TA was a fair marker. He seems intimidating, but if you go to office hours and talk to him he is friendly, approachable and helpful if you need to ask question

While the lectures are not always super interesting, it is clear that David is interested in what he is talking about. He encourages questions, brings in guest lecturers, and provides personal field work stories. The tests are written, not m/c, so you will want to study the terms specifically, and in association with what was in the textbook.

Almost fell asleep couple of times. I'm not a history person so I did not enjoy this class at all. If you are interested in archaeological history, take this class if you will. Note: all exams are going to be written. All notes are on canvas but he talks more about it so attend even if you don't want to. Worst decision ever, to take this  class!

i went into this class thinking it would be interesting,and came out not impressed. He doesn't give much instruction or help and his lectures are so boring, people fall asleep. I would not take this class, the tests are all written. Waste of a class.
Most boring class I have taken, dont take this course.
Good prof and interesting material.
Really enjoyed the course. He likes to talk about things he was interested in so depends on whether you like to hear stories. I personally really enjoyed the course!
One of the worst electives I have taken, advice: never take any courses taught by this prof

Do not take this course as a gpa booster or when taking more than four courses. I am taking 5 courses and in my final semester thinking this course can be easily completed for credits. Lectures are interesting, but too much info. Exams are not entirely related to lecture, but demand your critical thinking to apply beyond course knowledge.

says TB required but not actually used. Only 2asgn+2exams w dependence on lec material. Exams require you to think beyond course material/memorizing and apply knowledge. Lec presented in voiceover slides+PDF with tons of visuals and key points relevant to subject. Reasonable amount of info to study applicable to future studies in diff fields.

Really great for an online class, he recorded audio lectures so everything actually made so much sense. He's a really funny guy, I enjoyed his lectures. Exams were very fair and you'll do well if study. Assignments were short and sweet and grading criteria very clear. He also includes examples of his own field work which was cool.

he seems like a passionate guy, but he was the most dry and monotone lecturer ive ever had the poor fate to come across. there is so much content in this course its almost impossible to learn it all, and exams where difficult. took this as a grade booster and cause i was interested, but ill never take another arch course again.

This prof is very understanding of students and posts recorded lectures and slides. This allows me to pay full attention to him without worrying about taking notes fast. Pretty heavy lecture content but interesting course. He loves archaeology its so wholesome. This class will not make you feel pressured, not fast paced.

Finally a proper lecturer! He's great, the content was great, and he makes studying easy by having his lectures recorded and posted online with the power points! This took a bit of pressure off note taking, so that I could focus on absorbing and understanding the concepts he was presenting to us.

Very nice person! Cares about the subject matter and is a seasoned archaeologist himself. However, every lecture is supplemented with 70+ slides with A LOT of info on each. He uses the same slides for his other classes so he'll often say "don't bother with this part" and it's hard to keep track of what to focus on. Wayyy too much detail on slides.

How is David Maxwell? The answer is we don't know. (u will get this after his courses ) JK! Mr. Maxwell is very good, he is glad to help students and really kind. Lectures are heavy, but he does not care and test any detail and grammar. The exams do not include multiple-choice, only short answer (sometimes long answer questions ).

Just finishing September but I already know David Maxwell is a professor I'll take again! His lectures have been fun, englightening, and he's very passionate about archaeology and is a very experienced archaeologist himself. He just seems like a super nice person all around. Lectures are peppered with humour and fun facts. Great class so far

Made the right choice by not buying the textbook! Maxwells kinda funny in lecture, but super boring n often repeats jokes. Could skip class no problem (he just reads off the slides anyways) but reviewing his slides sucks... it makes the written exams really hard to study for. I hear ARCH100 has multiple choice exams... what i wouldnt give...

He's nice, but a grueling lecturer. Grades are based off only the midterm, paper, and final, each 33%. Studying is painful: powerpoints generally 90-120 slides long, unorganized, and packed with info. Worse is that ANY info is testable, with no study guide, and exams are entirely written format. The only plus? You seriously don't need the textbook.

Kinda just reads off the slides but I don't mind that. Tests are reasonably hard but straightforward. Textbook is really not useful. Lecture materials are very important and the assignment is long and boring but clear.
He is a blunt prof. Lectures aren't that interactive. Lectures are boring. Assignments are tough so are the exams.

He's a bit dry, but if you like documentaries you'll enjoy this course; they make up about half of the lecture time and he pulls exam questions from them. He's also open-minded and marks fairly. Case in point: My scathing final paper/book review of "Archaeology Matters" concluded that archaeology actually doesn't matter, and he still awarded an A+.

His explanations are not consistent. Assignment description completely vague, I have a high academic standing and he gave me a zero for not writing what he 'wanted'. He tells you nothing, and expects so much from the assignments. Tests are easy but assignments difficult. He is not clear at all. Very indecisive and lazy professor.

Interesting top, but lazy pro. mltiple choice for both mid-term and final. 2 papers are required and he promise a C for the paper since it's intro but I got 0. vague explanation. I would recommend this course but ASK questions of what he wants. I did everything he asked but didn't get good mark. Have NO IDEA what happened.

I really enjoyed David's class! The lectures were a bit dull, but the assignments were really interesting! This was my first A in university. On a side note, it was the TA, Elizabeth Peterson, who I found to be the best part of the course. So helpful! She helped clarify the assignments and was so friendly.

David seems like a really intelligent guy! He clearly knows a lot about archaeology. The only downside is he basically reads off the slides, so it really isn't necessary to come to class. His assignments are very creative and the he is a good teacher!
Very good prof! lectures/slides are very clear and helpful. the book is somewhat used on the key terms. Read the lecture notes for exams and understand some of the small details. very helpful prof..
A little dull at times, but over all a really good prof! Study the slides well and the class is easy!
No Comments
have a care about this one and be very very careful. he says one thing when describing assignments but then flip flops. okay too look at but attractiveness can go only so far!
Very organised, good sense of humour, Lots of field experience and has a lot of slides.

Watch out for this 1.Jumps around in thought every 2 secs. Gives you 1 criteria, marks you on another. If you want to drop your GPA take this course.Appeal grade if something 'seems wrong'. Power tripper.Also 3hrs & 2mins bathroom break.Good luck.

My absolute favourite class and professor from the semester. Lectures were engaging and often quite entertaining, and complimented the textbook very well; little repetition, but one was necessary to understand the other. Assignments were very clear and feedback was excellent, especially in Canvas discussions to help us plan our final paper.
Very good teacher. Disragard others bad comments. She expects students to be analytical and self-motivated; if you get a bad mark its because you aren't able to take your learning to a higher level.

Attendance at lectures is absolutely crucial, yet they are super boring. The research paper is heavy for an introductory class (15-20 pages), and with the exam that is 80% of your mark. I would recommend trying this course with someone else.

Do not expect an easy course out of him. Hayden is one of those professors who is more in tuned with actual research than teaching. His lectures do not have flow and expects most of your knowledge to come from the textbook. The assignments are poorly described as his lectures are purely oral and no online help was available, except via e-mail.

VERY BORING lectures.  he wasn't  helpful & hard to reach him, especially since he doesn't give out his e-mail.  Also, not very friendly (doesn't seem to like his students).  TA was really helpful, but need to attend his lecs b/c it's on his mt.
I liked Brian. He's a good man, lots of people are all harshed out with this guy, but straight-up, he's a really informed, passionate, and interesting prof. take his class.

Listen to what he says not what he writes, that's teh key to getting A's on his exams. He's way to fair giving tones of bonus marks, he wants everyone to succeed. Go see him in office hours if you need help, he's ALWAYS there, overall a great guy!

Very unorganized, didn't have proper notes to do his lectures from. Went off on random tangents all the time and the textbook was also horrible. He is very vague and you never know what he is looking for in his marking. Very arty-farty. He disses real scientists who actually validate his job of interpreting archeological remains.
George is a great teacher and is very knowledgeable about the subject matter. Feel bad he had to deal with a tonne of jerks in his class last semester. Would definately take a class from him again.

Awesome guy. Extremely helpful and genuinely interested in his students and the class. This class was intro and obviously the subject matter was a bit dry but he did his best to spice it up.  Some real jerks for people took this class which made it awkward, especially when dealing with touchy subjects.  Nicholas did his best to prevent explosions.

Awesome class and awesome prof!!  Nicholas is funny and his material was appropriate for an intro class.  Naysayers were most likely non-arch majors who were looking for an easy credit but didn't get it (class was full of such).  Text was a bit tedious and readings for quizzes were heavy, but George was great.  I will take anything I can with him.
Unless you want to die of boredom.. do not take this class!  You will learn NOTHING!!!

Muir was okay, but his choice of TA was terrible. Very rude and not willing to help and made that clear. I worked so hard in this class and think the prof should go over some of the marking before he uses her again.
His TA marks hard on the essays, more emphasis on grammatical errors >.> He has the boring voice ever...

If you don't even have a remote interest in archaeologist, do yourself a favor and stay away from this course. Muir generaly has the "I hate teaching" and the TA marks way too hard. Doesn't help the fact there's no tutorials in this course for assignment help.

He seems like a nice guy, but he's a boring prof. He has a monotone voice, often stares at the ground while lecturing, and generally seems bored to be here. I had taken ARCH 100 with a different prof and it developed my interest in archaeology-but that was soon gone after taking this class. I wouldn't recommend taking a class with him at all.
Really nice professor, fare exam, must attend class.

He seems to find teaching a chore. He sighs loudly as he presents each slide. He also leaves each lecture early when he plays a movie. (It's embarassing.) Furthermore, does anyone else find it audacious and even immoral that he is asking a class of 30-odd students to write a paper that affirms his relevancy as an archaeologist?
Great teacher! Nice, helpful, and easy-going. He's one of my favourite arch teachers at SFU

Don't listen to any of the negative comments about this guy. Bob is the best prof in this university. He understands students and make his course very easy. Just study lecture notes and you will be gareenteed an A or A+. They truly don't come any better than Bob at the university level. Its very hard to find good profs. Exams are cake.Itook 100+201

This prof is somewhat bored at teaching the material. He drones on and on but the notes are interesting. However DON'T USE HIS NOTES ON MIDTERMS OR FINALS. Most of the stuff u need 2 kno are gonna be in the textbook. So there4, dun even bother goin 2 lecture.

Interesting class. Easy midterm. Lecture material well chosen and available on WebCT. Great films shown in class, too. Bob always looks at the ground when speaking, but what can you expect--he's an archaeologist! Pretty good overall.
Not the easiest class but a very interesting one. Just make sure you go to lecture and you'll be fine.
A good guy. His lectures are a bit boring, but he puts everything online and makes everything really clear which is helpful. Lots of movies, too, so a good oppertunity for sleep.
Boring at first, but he kinda grows on ya. Good Power Point lectures. Divides marks up well - not just a midterm and a final.
